name: circularity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of constantly returning to the same point or situation: the circularity of political arguments Scholars have frequently noted the circularity of the 19th-century rule that a promise is not binding unless given in exchange for a binding promise.
the fact of being shaped like a circle: I'd see a stone with just the right qualities of flatness, circularity, and weight. The sloping site and emphasis on circularity gives the garden a feeling of space. See
circular
More examplesFewer examplesThe story has an almost too-perfect circularity to it.By then her career was taking on a certain bleak circularity: just as Strangers on a Train had been rejected by six publishers at the start, so her final novel was rejected.The wheel was ground to perfect circularity.The lack of perfect circularity of the Earth's orbit is known as its eccentricity.
